ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

causeCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIndexedCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.
Each of these errors MUST have index set.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIsInternal.description: If true, then the cause (`causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection`) should be hidden from the user.

causeSimple.description:
Simple string error type.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

code.description:
the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

Deprecated: Prefer to check the request's HTTP response code directly.

details.description:
The optional details of the error response.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeSimple`.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

Deprecated: Use "values" instead.

domain.description:
The "domain" for the error.  If empty, it is an EDA
core error.  Alternatively it can be an EDA application
"apiVersion" value (e.g. interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1)
indicating that the error is specific to that application.
The domain gives the receiver information that they can use
to help them interpret the "type" field.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists.
This needs to be flexible so we can support multiple formats.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeCollection` or `causeIndexedCollection` instead.

internal.description:
Internal error code number.

Deprecated: "type" & "domain" should be used instead to uniquely identify this error.

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request.

type.description:
Type defines a unique identifier for the error, within the domain.
This may be used (along with the domain) to find an internationalization translation for the message.

SHOULD be a valid golang identifier, and SHOULD be in UpperCamelCase.

values.description:
Associated data/information.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted with information from this dictionary.

Note that this map MUST NOT contain JSON objects (`{...}`) or arrays (`[...]`), only simple JSON types are permitted.

ErrorResponse.title: Generic error response for REST APIs.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

com.nokia.eda.otlp.v1alpha1.ClusterMetri.description: ClusterMetricExport is the Schema for the clustermetricexports API

The kind must be set to ClusterMetricExport

spec.description: ClusterMetricExportSpec defines the desired state of ClusterMetricExport

exports.description:
List of metrics and their sources to be written to a remote server.
Metrics will be sent using the Prometheus remote write protocol.

attributes.description: Allows adding static or dynamic attributes to the metrics.

dynamic.description: List of dynamic attributes to add to the metrics, based on a state DB path.

field.description: The field name to add as a attribute
field.title: Field

path.description: The state DB path to export, in the format '.node.srl.interface'
path.title: Path

regex.description: A regular expression to be applied to the field value.
regex.title: Regex

replacement.description: A regular expression replacement to be applied to the field value.
replacement.title: Replacement

static.description: List of static attributes to add to the metrics.
static.title: Static Attributes

attributes.title: Attributes

fields.description: Optional set of fields to be exposed by this export.
fields.title: Fields

interval.description: Period defines the frequency at which the metric is polled.
interval.title: Polling Interval

mappings.description: Rules for mapping metric values (e.g., DOWN -> 1, UP -> 2).

destination.description: The new value for the mapped source (must convert to float64).
destination.title: Mapped Value

source.description: The value to be mapped (supports regex with capture groups).
source.title: Source Value

mappings.title: Metric Value Mappings

metricName.description: Regex and replacement for renaming the metric name.

regex.description: Regular expression for the metric name transformation.
regex.title: Metric Name Regex

replacement.description: Replacement string for the transformed metric name.
replacement.title: Metric Name Replacement

metricName.title: Metric Name Transformation

mode.description: Mode defines how the metric is collected: periodic, on-change, or periodic-on-change.
mode.title: Collection Mode

path.description: The state DB path to export, in the format '.node.srl.interface'
path.title: Path

resource.description:
A Custom resource to be used as a source for the metric.
It will generate a metric with the CR attributes and a value of 1.

attributes.description:
List of attributes to include with the metric.
Include all if not set.
attributes.title: Attributes

name.description:
CR name to be queried.
Get all of not set.
name.title: Name

namespace.description: The CR namespace, it defaults to all if not specified.
namespace.title: Namespace

version.description: The CR version such as `v1` or `v1alpha1`.
version.title: Version

resource.title: Custom Resource

where.description: Condition for filtering the metric (e.g., 'oper-state = down').
where.title: Where

exports.title: Metrics Exports

receivers.description: List of remote destination names where metrics will be written.
receivers.title: Destination Servers

skipVerify.description: If true the client will not verify the server's certificate.

fromSecret.description:
Secret containing a `tls.crt`, a `tls.key` and a `ca.crt` keys.
Both `tls.crt` and `tls.key` must be present.
If `ca.crt` is not present and `.trustBundle` is not set
the remote server certificate is not verified.

trustBundle.description:
ConfigMap containing a set of trust bundles (key `trust-bundle.pem`) used to
verify the remote server certificates.
trustBundle.title: Trust Bundle

bufferSize.title: Buffer Size

flushInterval.description:
Interval at which metrics stored in the local buffer are sent to the receiver.
Metrics are sent regardless of the buffer size threshold.
flushInterval.title: Interval

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to be sent along with each remote write request.
headers.title: Headers

maxMetricsPerExport.title: Max Metrics per export

delete.description:
Delete all instances of ClusterMetricExport.  If ClusterMetricExport is a namespaced resource, all instances in all namespaces will
be deleted, and this is restricted to users with the system-administrator role.
If a non-namespaced ClusterMetricExport, it deletes all instances of that non-namespaced resource.
